title: 'No fear' — McCullum pushes Qalandars to unleash their potential
text:
Faizan Lakhani Posted on February 17, 2017 
DUBAI: Skipper Lahore Qalandars Brendon McCullum said that he wants his team to play like true Qalandars – by being selfless and fearless cricketers. 
Speaking with geo.tv, the right-hand Kiwi batsman said that when the team first sat down, they discussed ‘what it is meant to be a Qalandar’, “It is being the selfless and fearless and it is exactly the kind of cricketers we wanted to have in the squad.” 
McCullum is all praises for his team as he stated that that “first and foremost the guys are good people, we have got excellent cricketers” he added, “coupled with the bond in the team is for a common cause and that is a real benefit.” 
In his words, the Lahore Qalandars squad members have gelled together beautifully. “We have a nice group of owners, nice group of support staff and obviously huge fan following back in Lahore,” he added.” Hopefully, we continue to develop as a team and win the tournament.” 
Putting light on his captaincy, he said: “I want the guys to play with freedom. If you take that fear of failure away and when u give guys the opportunity to discover themselves as players, to develop as players quicker than what they would have while being paralysed in fear than ultimately in twenty-thirty years’ time they can sit and look back their experiences.” 
The former New Zealand skipper said that he is having a fantastic time at Pakistan Super League as he is witnessing great competition in high-quality cricket matches. 
On PSL, he opined that as what IPL did for India as by giving their young players an opportunity to develop their acumen by playing along with successful international cricketers; the same trend is being followed in the Pakistani league. He predicted that: “we will see the benefit of PSL in coming years when younger guys will develop at a quicker rate than probably they wouldn’t have without PSL.” 
He said: “we have already seen the development and emergence of guy like Muhammad Irfan (Jr) in a short space of time and there are couple of other guys who are waiting so when they get their chance I am really confident that they will be able to stand up and deliver on a big stage just as Irfan has done.” 
Calling the player development programme of Lahore Qalandar as, ‘phenomenal’, he said that it is one of the success stories of the PSL in which around 120,000 people turned up for a trial of a franchise. 
“The owners must be applauded for their foresight to give those opportunities to appear on a big stage.” 
On the question of, “Is it tough to captain a team with diverse cricketing backgrounds?” 
McCullum said that in fact he finds it more exciting because it gives him an opportunity to be able to keep this sort of experiences where he gives players the freedom to push their skill set and to understand the perspectives of different walks of life, 
“Different upbringing, different ethnicities make the dressing room vast and all these guys come closer for one common cause.” 
He thanked the people of Lahore for supporting the team and said that his thoughts are with the people who had gone through a very tough week.
